Articles.Content:
Well here's a thing I thought of sometime ago, and it really worked.

this is basically a giant fan with 650 m/s~ top speed. Spin to go faster and do not aim up.

Download

Edited August 21, 2012 by rex22mm

It works really well!- here's a demonstration:

I also added wings and a pillar from mechanical mouse's mod pack just to support it through the initial take off, and so that it would remain stable thereafter.
you should redo that image thing it brings you to an album that you can click next to go through showing all your picks AND Ã¢â‚¬â€¹a bunch more that are just odd?

Heh, these have been around for quite a while. With a tiny bit of modding, you can get them to escape velocity.

Just change the movement range.
Thats got to be the most stable rocket i've ever seen.

I made a few modifications and was able to reach a surface speed of over 1200 m/s just by spinning. My version was two rows of "wings" on a structural fuselage. only a small tank and the TL-45 engine attached to the thing with a decoupler to clear the launch tower.

[EDIT] A further improved craft made over 1800 m/s while rising to an apoapsis of 80+ km.

Edited August 22, 2012 by heikkik
